update.description:
this is rewrited version of #!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/115/add-apollo15_landing_site_1000x/diff, 
finally I have understand dtm format and create new hightmap, using https://gist.github.com/k-okada/b76a6a3c32dd77890577

this time I created map around dune crater http://www.google.com/moon/#lat=26.006452&lon=3.666045&zoom=15&apollo=a15/20


![apollo_15_landing_site_dune_crater.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/bedE4R/images/1659185735-apollo_15_landing_site_dune_crater.jpg)

![Screenshot from 2015-03-05 12:27:12.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/751619090-Screenshot%20from%202015-03-05%2012:27:12.jpg)
update.title: add apollo15_landing_site

content.raw: It works for me.
content.html: It works for me.

content.raw: Ahh, right. We could do that. I'll put that on the list of changes to make.
content.html: Ahh, right. We could do that. I'll put that on the list of changes to make.

content.raw: I was thinking on using the file with version 1.4 for people with older versions but not a big deal.
content.html: I was thinking on using the file with version 1.4 for people with older versions but not a big deal.

content.raw: They are the same. There is no harm in keeping both, that way someone with an older version of sdformat can still use the model.
content.html: They are the same. There is no harm in keeping both, that way someone with an older version of sdformat can still use the model.

content.raw: Do we need one sdf file for SDFormat v1.4 and a different file for SDFormat v1.5? It seems that the files are equal.
content.html: Do we need one sdf file for SDFormat v1.4 and a different file for SDFormat v1.5? It seems that the files are equal.

content.raw:
I approved this, and will fix my two comments once merged in.

**Note:** Merging this won't make it appear in the model database, so we have a bit of flexibility. We'll update the model database once the associated gazebo pull request is merged, and the two comments in this PR are resolved.
content.html:
I approved this, and will fix my two comments once merged in.

Note: Merging this won't make it appear in the model database, so we have a bit of flexibility. We'll update the model database once the associated gazebo pull request is merged, and the two comments in this PR are resolved.

content.raw: This should also be `model://`
content.html: This should also be model://

content.raw: Ran into a texture loading issue that is fixed in [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1592](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1592)
content.html: Ran into a texture loading issue that is fixed in https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1592

content.raw: Replace `file://` with `model://`.
content.html: Replace file:// with model://.

content.raw: I take that back. It [seems to be possible](http://mercurial.selenic.com/wiki/ConcatenatingChangesets), though I've never done it.
content.html: I take that back. It seems to be possible, though I've never done it.

content.raw: Alas, we can't squash with mercurial...
content.html: Alas, we can't squash with mercurial...

content.raw: updated, should I squash them?
content.html: updated, should I squash them?

content.raw:
ok, maybe we need new sdf element such as `<planet>moon</planet>` to release this kind of features.

![Screenshot from 2015-03-05 12:27:12.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3143867540-Screenshot_from_2015-03-05_122712.jpg)
content.html: ok, maybe we need new sdf element such as <planet>moon</planet> to release this kind of features.

content.raw: ticketed [gazebo issue #1488](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/1488/cannot-diasble-clouds-in-skyx)
content.html: ticketed gazebo issue #1488

content.raw:
ya looks like a bug. 

you can modify [SkyX_Moon.png](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/default/media/skyx/SkyX_Moon.png) with an image editing tool, paste a picture of earth over it and it should just work. The png file should be located in `[install prefix]/share/gazebo-2.0/media/skyx/`
content.html:
ya looks like a bug.

you can modify SkyX_Moon.png with an image editing tool, paste a picture of earth over it and it should just work. The png file should be located in [install prefix]/share/gazebo-2.0/media/skyx/

content.raw:
Wow!, if we set
```
        <clouds>
          <humidity>0</humidity>
        </clouds>
```
the clouds gone, after 30 sec... Is it a bug? I'm using gazebo2 on indigo. ans how easy to switch the moon for the earth.
content.html:
Wow!, if we set

        <clouds>
          <humidity>0</humidity>
        </clouds>

the clouds gone, after 30 sec... Is it a bug? I'm using gazebo2 on indigo. ans how easy to switch the moon for the earth.

content.raw: Nice! It has clouds and a moon though. We should switch the moon for the earth.
content.html: Nice! It has clouds and a moon though. We should switch the moon for the earth.

content.raw:
try adding this somewhere inside the `<world>`  element of your world file
~~~
    <scene>
      <ambient>0.1 0.1 0.1 1.0</ambient>
      <background>0.1 0.1 0.1 1</background>
      <grid>false</grid>
      <sky>
        <time>16</time>
        <sunrise>12</sunrise>
        <sunset>12</sunset>
      </sky>
    </scene>
~~~
content.html:
try adding this somewhere inside the <world> element of your world file

    <scene>
      <ambient>0.1 0.1 0.1 1.0</ambient>
      <background>0.1 0.1 0.1 1</background>
      <grid>false</grid>
      <sky>
        <time>16</time>
        <sunrise>12</sunrise>
        <sunset>12</sunset>
      </sky>
    </scene>

content.raw: The background color can be specified for world files, but not for model files. Maybe we can change the texture with skyx?
content.html: The background color can be specified for world files, but not for model files. Maybe we can change the texture with skyx?

content.raw: Yeah, is it possible to change background color/texture in gazebo? I think normal ODE has such interface...
content.html: Yeah, is it possible to change background color/texture in gazebo? I think normal ODE has such interface...

content.raw: It would be cool to make the gazebo background black or use a texture with stars.
content.html: It would be cool to make the gazebo background black or use a texture with stars.

content.raw: I believe the skyx material files we get are all in the [media/skyx](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/default/media/skyx/) folder. The [SkyX_Moon.png](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/default/media/skyx/SkyX_Moon.png) in there is mainly used for the background so it's probably not going to be useful as a texture for the moon surface.
content.html: I believe the skyx material files we get are all in the media/skyx folder. The SkyX_Moon.png in there is mainly used for the background so it's probably not going to be useful as a texture for the moon surface.

content.raw:
@iche033 I remember that OSRF used to support 'http://www.paradise-studios.net/', which is try to make realistic rendering of the scene, do you, or any of your colleague,  know better texture image for the moon surface? I created this image from Apollo image gallery, but not seems good.  
https://web.archive.org/web/20130307201333/http://www.osrfoundation.org/projects.html
content.html:
@iche033 I remember that OSRF used to support 'http://www.paradise-studios.net/', which is try to make realistic rendering of the scene, do you, or any of your colleague, know better texture image for the moon surface? I created this image from Apollo image gallery, but not seems good.
https://web.archive.org/web/20130307201333/http://www.osrfoundation.org/projects.html
